author: Special Correspondent
text:
David J Gross, Professor of physics at the University of California visited the PSG Institutions in commemoration of the 90th year of PSG and Sons Charities on December 30.

He laid the foundation stone for a science and technology Museum to come up on the 40,000 sq ft Neelambur campus of the PSG Institute of Technology and Applied Research. It will cost Rs. 25 crore, and will be opened to the public by 2017. Mr. Gross was awarded Nobel Laureate in 2006.

The museum will showcase the growth of science and technology through the ages. The institution plans to collaborate with science and technology museums, industrial organisations, research centres and educational institutions in India and abroad.
title: Foundation laid for science museum
